alert.note: Alert for Hooker; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Hooker and northwestern Thomas Counties through 900 PM CDT/800 PM MDT/... At 812 PM CDT/712 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Thedford to 9 miles southwest of Mullen to 6 miles southeast of Whitman. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Thedford, Seneca, Norway, Hecla, Kelso and Weir. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 165 and 210. Highway 97 between mile markers 54 and 67. Highway 83 between mile markers 139 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
